high-score-content.content:
*Pregnancy Health Check*
💜⚪⚪

Thank you for sharing! You're making healthy decisions for you and your unborn child 💪🏽

Remember:

• A healthy pregnancy needs healthy foods. Follow the health worker's advice 🥬🥚🥛🍎

• And stay away from alcohol and cigarettes while you are pregnant or breastfeeding. It can harm your baby 🚬🍷

high-score-content.content:
*Pregnancy Health Check*
💜💙⚪

Thank you for taking the time to answer these! You know a lot about healthy pregnancy 🙌🏽

*Here are the main points*
• It's best to go to the clinic as soon as you know you're pregnant. This first pregnancy check-up should be before 14 weeks. You should have 8 or more check-ups in total 🏥

• If your tummy stays tight, hard and is very painful you need to go to the clinic 🤰🏾

• At your pregnancy check-ups, you should get the tetanus vaccine. This helps protect you and your baby after birth 💉

• Iron and folic acid supplements are important for you and your unborn baby 💪🏽

You ready for the last 3 pregnancy questions? 👇🏽

Reply with 'Yes' or 'Remind me tomorrow'

high-score-content.content:
*Pregnancy Health Check*
💜💙💛

Thank you for answering all these questions! You have completed all the questions and you know a lot about healthy pregnancy.

*Remember*
• Keep going to your pregnancy check-ups. This is important for you and baby 🏥

• Try to plan to give birth at a clinic or hospital - it's generally safer. If not, have a skilled birth attendant to help you at the birth 💛

• Get an HIV test when you have your pregnancy check-up. Early treatment can keep you healthy and protect baby 👶🏽

Thank you, you've completed the health check!

*How easy was it to complete this?*
a. Very easy
b. A little easy
c. OK
d. A little difficult
e. Very difficult
